**V1.6.0 - 30th July 2013** #Introduction These pages contain documentation about each of the custom controls which are provided for use with Teamstudio Unplugged The aim of the controls is that you will be able to quickly build a mobile application to deploy onto Teamstudio Unplugged, which runs on iOS and Android devices. We assume that you have used XPages before, but the actual use of the controls is not difficult, so you shouldn't need to have massive experience of mobile or web development to be able to create an application. These controls should work for "normal" [[mobile web development]] as well, so they could be accessed via the web browsers on your iPhone, iPad, or Android device. **IMPORTANT:** When running the sample application on your server, open the 'HomeLinks' view and ensure it is empty. Then open the 'Databases' view, select all documents and run the agent "Generate Home Workspace". This will create the documents required to populate the home page with icons. *** Detailed usage instructions for each control are available below. * [[unpAccordion]] - a view control for displaying categorized data * [[unpDebugToolbar]] - a developer toolbar similar to the full XPages Debug Toolbar available from OpenNTF * [[unpDialog]] - a simple control to display a modal dialog box * [[unpFlatView]] - a view control to display non categorized data * [[unpFooter]] - a simple control which displays the footer of the page * [[unpTabbedFooter]] - a control that displays navigation options in the footer of the page * [[unpFormEditor]] - a control which handles the layout and saving of data when in edit mode * [[unpFormViewer]] - a control which handles the layout of data in read mode and the buttons to switch into edit mode or create a response * [[unpHeader]] - a simple control which displays the header of the page, including a search box * [[unpScrollableArea]] - a control with no UI which makes anything inside it scrollable * [[unpSearchResults]] - a simple control to display search results * [[unpSwipeView]] - a control for viewing file attachments stored in documents, especially useful for images * [[unpNavigator]] - a menu control which will appear on the left of the screen * [[unpWorkspace]]- a standalone control for creating a workspace style layout of actions. Useful for large applications with lots of functions and areas *** [[Upgrading your application]] from a previous version of the controls library can be made easier by following some of our guidelines. *** You will be building two types of XPage, firstly the "Main" page which will handle the application layout. All of the other pages are going to be requested via Ajax so we only need to include the content section for those. #Building the UnpMain XPage The main XPage is going to control the display of the page including the header, views list and footer.
